FuncDef:
The if-match ipv6 route-source acl command configures a filtering rule that is based on IPv6 addresses of the source devices from which routes are received.
The undo if-match ipv6 route-source acl command cancels the configuration. The if-match ipv6 route-source acl command configures a filtering rule that is based on IPv6 addresses of the source devices from which routes are received. The undo if-match ipv6 route-source acl command cancels the configuration. By default, no filtering rule based on IPv6 addresses of the source devices from which routes are received is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of a basic ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

Specifies the name of a named basic ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the ACL for route filtering.
-

ExtraInfo: When you run the if-match ipv6 route-source acl command to match the address of the source from which IPv6 routes are received, an ACL must also be configured for the matching rule to take effect. For example:
